meanings.definition: A thought occurring after the main thought or action.
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, she had some afterthoughts about what she should have said.
meanings.sent2: His afterthoughts about the project helped improve its overall quality.
meanings.sent3: Her afterthoughts about the party made her realize she forgot to thank the host.
meanings.sent4: The afterthoughts of regret haunted him long after the decision was made.
meanings.sent5: The afterthoughts of missed opportunities lingered in his mind.

meanings.sent1: He quickly jotted down some afterthoughts on the bottom of the page.
meanings.sent2: The dessert was delicious, but the afterthoughts of adding whipped cream made it even better.
meanings.sent3: The afterthoughts of sprinkling some extra cheese on the pizza made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The afterthoughts of including a personal note in the gift made it more special.
meanings.sent5: The afterthoughts of buying a matching accessory completed her outfit perfectly.
